Name: Sakila Sample Firebird Schema
Description: Sakila Sample Database Schema for Firebird

Tables.Name: ACTOR
Tables.Description: This table lists information for all actors. The table is joined to the @table:FILM table by means of the @table:FILM_ACTOR table.

Columns.Name: ACTOR_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each actor in the table.

Columns.Name: FIRST_NAME
Columns.Description: The actor first name.

Columns.Name: LAST_NAME
Columns.Description: The actor last name.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: ADDRESS
Tables.Description: This table contains address information for customers, staff, and stores. The table primary key appears as a foreign key in the @table:CUSTOMER, @table:STAFF, and @table:STORE tables.

Columns.Name: ADDRESS_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each address in the table.

Columns.Name: ADDRESS
Columns.Description: The first line of an address.

Columns.Name: ADDRESS2
Columns.Description: An optional second line of an address.

Columns.Name: DISTRICT
Columns.Description: The region of an address, this may be a state, province, prefecture, etc.

Columns.Name: CITY_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key pointing to the @table:CITY table.

Columns.Name: POSTAL_CODE
Columns.Description: The postal code or ZIP code of the address (where applicable).

Columns.Name: PHONE
Columns.Description: The telephone number for the address.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: CATEGORY
Tables.Description: This table lists the categories that can be assigned to a film. The table is joined to the @table:FILM table by means of the @table:FILM_CATEGORY table.

Columns.Name: CATEGORY_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each category in the table.

Columns.Name: NAME
Columns.Description: The name of the category.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: CITY
Tables.Description: This table contains a list of cities. The table is referred to by a foreign key in the @table:ADDRESS table and refers to the @table:COUNTRY table using a foreign key.

Columns.Name: CITY_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each city in the table.

Columns.Name: CITY
Columns.Description: The name of the city.

Columns.Name: COUNTRY_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key identifying the country that the city belongs to.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: COUNTRY
Tables.Description: This table contains a list of countries. The table is referred to by a foreign key in the @table:CITY table.

Columns.Name: COUNTRY_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each country in the table.

Columns.Name: COUNTRY
Columns.Description: The name of the country.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: CUSTOMER
Tables.Description: This table contains a list of all customers. The table is referred to in the @table:PAYMENT and @table:RENTAL tables and refers to the @table:ADDRESS and @table:STORE tables using foreign keys.

Columns.Name: CUSTOMER_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each customer in the table.

Columns.Name: STORE_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key identifying the customer home store. Customers are not limited to renting only from this store, but this is the store at which they generally shop.

Columns.Name: FIRST_NAME
Columns.Description: The customer first name.

Columns.Name: LAST_NAME
Columns.Description: The customer last name.

Columns.Name: EMAIL
Columns.Description: The customer email address.

Columns.Name: ADDRESS_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key identifying the customer address in the @table:ADDRESS table.

Columns.Name: ACTIVE
Columns.Description: Indicates whether the customer is an active customer. Setting this to FALSE serves as an alternative to deleting a customer outright. Most queries should have a WHERE ACTIVE = TRUE clause.

Columns.Name: CREATE_DATE
Columns.Description: The date the customer was added to the system. This date is automatically set using a trigger during an INSERT.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: FILM
Tables.Description: This table is a list of all films potentially in stock in the stores. The actual in-stock copies of each film are represented in the inventory table. The table refers to the @table:LANGUAGE table and is referred to by the @table:FILM_CATEGORY, @table:FILM_ACTOR, and @table:INVENTORY tables.

Columns.Name: FILM_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each film in the table.

Columns.Name: TITLE
Columns.Description: The title of the film.

Columns.Name: DESCRIPTION
Columns.Description: A short description or plot summary of the film.

Columns.Name: RELEASE_YEAR
Columns.Description: The year in which the movie was released.

Columns.Name: LANGUAGE_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key pointing at the @table:LANGUAGE table; identifies the language of the film.

Columns.Name: ORIGINAL_LANGUAGE_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key pointing at the @table:LANGUAGE table; identifies the original language of the film. Used when a film has been dubbed into a new language.

Columns.Name: RENTAL_DURATION
Columns.Description: The length of the rental period, in days.

Columns.Name: RENTAL_RATE
Columns.Description: The cost to rent the film for the period specified in the RENTAL_DURATION column.

Columns.Name: LENGTH
Columns.Description: The duration of the film, in minutes.

Columns.Name: REPLACEMENT_COST
Columns.Description: The amount charged to the customer if the film is not returned or is returned in a damaged state.

Columns.Name: RATING
Columns.Description: The rating assigned to the film. Can be one of: G, PG, PG-13, R, or NC-17.

ValidValues.Description: Parental guidance suggested – Some material may not be suitable for children.
Parents strongly cautioned – Some material may be inappropriate for children under 13.
Restricted – Under 17 requires accompanying parent or adult guardian.

Columns.Name: SPECIAL_FEATURES
Columns.Description: Lists which common special features are included on the DVD. Can be zero or more of: Trailers, Commentaries, Deleted Scenes, Behind the Scenes.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: FILM_ACTOR
Tables.Description: This table is used to support a many-to-many relationship between films and actors. For each actor in a given film, there will be one row in the @table:FILM_ACTOR table listing the actor and film. The table refers to the @table:FILM and @table:ACTOR tables using foreign keys.

Columns.Name: ACTOR_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key identifying the actor.

Columns.Name: FILM_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key identifying the film.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: FILM_CATEGORY
Tables.Description: This table is used to support a many-to-many relationship between films and categories. For each category applied to a film, there will be one row in the @table:FILM_CATEGORY table listing the category and film. The table refers to the @table:FILM and @table:CATEGORY tables using foreign keys.

Columns.Name: FILM_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key identifying the film.

Columns.Name: CATEGORY_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key identifying the category.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: FILM_TEXT
Tables.Description: This table contains the FILM_ID, TITLE and DESCRIPTION columns of the @table:FILM table, with the contents of the table kept in synchrony with the @table:FILM table by means of triggers on @table:film table INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE operations.

Columns.Name: FILM_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each film in the table.

Columns.Name: TITLE
Columns.Description: The title of the film.

Columns.Name: DESCRIPTION
Columns.Description: A short description or plot summary of the film.

Tables.Name: INVENTORY
Tables.Description: This table contains one row for each copy of a given film in a given store. The table refers to the @table:FILM and @table:STORE tables using foreign keys and is referred to by the @table:RENTAL table.

Columns.Name: INVENTORY_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each item in inventory.

Columns.Name: FILM_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key pointing to the film this item represents.

Columns.Name: STORE_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key pointing to the store stocking this item.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: LANGUAGE
Tables.Description: This table is a lookup table listing the possible languages that films can have for their language and original language values. The table is referred to by the @table:FILM table.

Columns.Name: LANGUAGE_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each language.

Columns.Name: NAME
Columns.Description: The English name of the language.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: PAYMENT
Tables.Description: This table records each payment made by a customer, with information such as the amount and the rental being paid for (when applicable). The table refers to the @table:CUSTOMER, @table:RENTAL, and @table:STAFF table.

Columns.Name: PAYMENT_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each payment.

Columns.Name: CUSTOMER_ID
Columns.Description: The customer whose balance the payment is being applied to. This is a foreign key reference to the @table:CUSTOMER table.

Columns.Name: STAFF_ID
Columns.Description: The staff member who processed the payment. This is a foreign key reference to the @table:STAFF table.

Columns.Name: RENTAL_ID
Columns.Description: The rental that the payment is being applied to. This is optional because some payments are for outstanding fees and may not be directly related to a rental.

Columns.Name: AMOUNT
Columns.Description: The amount of the payment.

Columns.Name: PAYMENT_DATE
Columns.Description: The date the payment was processed.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: RENTAL
Tables.Description: This table contains one row for each rental of each inventory item with information about who rented what item, when it was rented, and when it was returned. The table refers to the @table:INVENTORY, @table:CUSTOMER, and @table:STAFF tables and is referred to by the @table:PAYMENT table.

Columns.Name: RENTAL_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key that uniquely identifies the rental.

Columns.Name: RENTAL_DATE
Columns.Description: The date and time that the item was rented.

Columns.Name: INVENTORY_ID
Columns.Description: The item being rented.

Columns.Name: CUSTOMER_ID
Columns.Description: The customer renting the item.

Columns.Name: RETURN_DATE
Columns.Description: The date and time the item was returned.

Columns.Name: STAFF_ID
Columns.Description: The staff member who processed the rental.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: STAFF
Tables.Description: This table lists all staff members, including information for email address, login information, and picture. The table refers to the @table:STORE and @table:ADDRESS tables using foreign keys, and is referred to by the @table:RENTAL, @table:PAYMENT, and @table:STORE tables.

Columns.Name: STAFF_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key that uniquely identifies the staff member.

Columns.Name: FIRST_NAME
Columns.Description: The first name of the staff member.

Columns.Name: LAST_NAME
Columns.Description: The last name of the staff member.

Columns.Name: ADDRESS_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key to the staff member address in the @table:ADDRESS table.

Columns.Name: PICTURE
Columns.Description: A BLOB containing a photograph of the employee.

Columns.Name: EMAIL
Columns.Description: The staff member email address.

Columns.Name: STORE_ID
Columns.Description: The staff member home store. The employee can work at other stores but is generally assigned to the store listed.

Columns.Name: ACTIVE
Columns.Description: Whether this is an active employee. If employees leave, their rows are not deleted from this table; instead, this column is set to FALSE.

Columns.Name: USERNAME
Columns.Description: The user name used by the staff member to access the rental system.

Columns.Name: PASSWORD
Columns.Description: The password used by the staff member to access the rental system. The password should be stored as a secure hash.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Tables.Name: STORE
Tables.Description: This table lists all stores in the system. All inventory is assigned to specific stores, and staff and customers are assigned a home store. The table refers to the @table:STAFF and @table:ADDRESS tables using foreign keys and is referred to by the @table:STAFF, @table:CUSTOMER, and @table:INVENTORY tables.

Columns.Name: STORE_ID
Columns.Description: A surrogate primary key that uniquely identifies the store.

Columns.Name: MANAGER_STAFF_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key identifying the manager of this store.

Columns.Name: ADDRESS_ID
Columns.Description: A foreign key identifying the address of this store.

Columns.Name: LAST_UPDATE
Columns.Description: When the row was created or most recently updated.

Views.Name: ACTOR_INFO
Views.Description: This view provides a list of all actors, including the films in which they have performed, broken down by category. The view incorporates data from the @table:FILM, @table:ACTOR, @table:CATEGORY, @table:FILM_ACTOR, and @table:FILM_CATEGORY tables.
Views.Source:
SELECT
  a.actor_id,
  a.first_name,
  a.last_name,
  LIST(
    c.name||': '||(
	  SELECT 
	    LIST(f.title, ', ')
      FROM 
	    film f
      INNER JOIN 
	    film_category fc ON f.film_id = fc.film_id
      INNER JOIN 
	    film_actor fa ON f.film_id = fa.film_id
      WHERE 
	    fc.category_id = c.category_id AND fa.actor_id = a.actor_id
    ), '; ') AS film_info
FROM 
  actor a
LEFT JOIN 
  film_actor fa ON a.actor_id = fa.actor_id
LEFT JOIN 
  film_category fc ON fa.film_id = fc.film_id
LEFT JOIN 
  category c ON fc.category_id = c.category_id
GROUP BY 
  a.actor_id, a.first_name, a.last_name

Views.Name: CUSTOMER_LIST
Views.Description: This view provides a list of customers, with first name and last name concatenated together and address information combined into a single view. The view incorporates data from the @table:CUSTOMER, @table:ADDRESS, @table:CITY, and @table:COUNTRY tables.
Views.Source:
SELECT 
  cu.customer_id AS ID,
  cu.first_name||' '||cu.last_name AS name,
  a.address AS address,
  a.postal_code AS "zip code",
  a.phone AS phone,
  city.city AS city,
  country.country AS country,
  case when cu.active=1 then 'active' else '' end AS notes,
  cu.store_id AS SID
FROM 
  customer AS cu 
JOIN  
  address AS a ON cu.address_id = a.address_id 
JOIN 
  city ON a.city_id = city.city_id
JOIN 
  country ON city.country_id = country.country_id

Views.Name: FILM_LIST
Views.Description: This view contains a formatted view of the @table:FILM table, with a comma-separated list of actors for each film. The view incorporates data from the @table:FILM, @table:CATEGORY, @table:FILM_CATEGORY, @table:ACTOR, and @table:FILM_ACTOR tables.
Views.Source:
SELECT 
  film.film_id AS FID,
  film.title AS title,
  film.description AS description,
  category.name AS category,
  film.rental_rate AS price,
  film.length AS length,
  film.rating AS rating,
  LIST(actor.first_name||' '||actor.last_name, ', ') AS actors
FROM 
  film 
LEFT JOIN 
  film_category ON film_category.film_id = film.film_id
LEFT JOIN 
  category ON category.category_id = film_category.category_id 
LEFT JOIN 
  film_actor ON film.film_id = film_actor.film_id 
LEFT JOIN 
  actor ON film_actor.actor_id = actor.actor_id
GROUP BY 
  film.film_id, 
  category.name, 
  film.title,
  film.description, 
  film.rental_rate, 
  film.length, 
  film.rating

Views.Name: NICER_BUT_SLOWER_FILM_LIST
Views.Description: This view contains a formatted view of the @table:FILM table, with a comma-separated list of the film's actors. The view differs from the @view:FILM_LIST view in the list of actors. The lettercase of the actor names is adjusted so that the first letter of each name is capitalized, rather than having the name in all-caps. As indicated in its name, this view performs additional processing and therefore takes longer to return data than the @view:FILM_LIST view. The view incorporates data from the @table:FILM, @table:CATEGORY, @table:FILM_CATEGORY, @table:ACTOR, and @table:FILM_ACTOR tables.
Views.Source:
SELECT 
  film.film_id AS FID, 
  film.title AS title, 
  film.description AS description, 
  category.name AS category, 
  film.rental_rate AS price,
  film.length AS length, 
  film.rating AS rating, 
  LIST(
	UPPER(SUBSTRING(actor.first_name from 1 for 1))||LOWER(SUBSTRING(actor.first_name from 2 for CHAR_LENGTH(actor.first_name)))||' '||
	UPPER(SUBSTRING(actor.last_name from 1 for 1))||LOWER(SUBSTRING(actor.last_name from 2 for CHAR_LENGTH(actor.last_name))), ', ') AS actors
FROM 
  film 
LEFT JOIN 
  film_category ON film_category.film_id = film.film_id
LEFT JOIN 
  category ON category.category_id = film_category.category_id 
LEFT JOIN 
  film_actor ON film.film_id = film_actor.film_id 
LEFT JOIN 
  actor ON film_actor.actor_id = actor.actor_id
GROUP BY 
  film.film_id, 
  category.name, 
  film.title,
  film.description, 
  film.rental_rate, 
  film.length, 
  film.rating

Views.Name: SALES_BY_FILM_CATEGORY
Views.Description: This view provides a list of total sales, broken down by individual film category. Because a film can be listed in multiple categories, it is not advisable to calculate aggregate sales by totalling the rows of this view. The view incorporates data from the @table:CATEGORY, @table:PAYMENT, @table:RENTAL, @table:INVENTORY, @table:FILM, @table:FILM_CATEGORY, and @table:CATEGORY tables.
Views.Source:
SELECT
  c.name AS category, 
  SUM(p.amount) AS total_sales
FROM 
  payment AS p
INNER JOIN 
  rental AS r ON p.rental_id = r.rental_id
INNER JOIN 
  inventory AS i ON r.inventory_id = i.inventory_id
INNER JOIN 
  film AS f ON i.film_id = f.film_id
INNER JOIN 
  film_category AS fc ON f.film_id = fc.film_id
INNER JOIN 
  category AS c ON fc.category_id = c.category_id
GROUP BY 
  c.name
ORDER BY 
  total_sales DESC

Views.Name: SALES_BY_STORE
Views.Description: This view provides a list of total sales, broken down by store. The view returns the store location, manager name, and total sales. The view incorporates data from the @table:CITY, @table:COUNTRY, @table:PAYMENT, @table:RENTAL, @table:INVENTORY, @table:STORE, @table:ADDRESS, and @table:STAFF tables.
Views.Source:
SELECT
  c.city||','||cy.country AS store,
  m.first_name||' '||m.last_name AS manager,
  SUM(p.amount) AS total_sales
FROM 
  payment AS p
INNER JOIN 
  rental AS r ON p.rental_id = r.rental_id
INNER JOIN 
  inventory AS i ON r.inventory_id = i.inventory_id
INNER JOIN 
  store AS s ON i.store_id = s.store_id
INNER JOIN 
  address AS a ON s.address_id = a.address_id
INNER JOIN 
  city AS c ON a.city_id = c.city_id
INNER JOIN 
  country AS cy ON c.country_id = cy.country_id
INNER JOIN 
  staff AS m ON s.manager_staff_id = m.staff_id
GROUP BY 
  s.store_id, store, manager

Views.Name: STAFF_LIST
Views.Description: This view provides a list of all staff members, including address and store information. The view incorporates data from the @table:STAFF and @table:ADDRESS tables.
Views.Source:
SELECT 
  s.staff_id AS ID,
  s.first_name||' '||s.last_name AS name, 
  a.address AS address, 
  a.postal_code AS "zip code",
  a.phone AS phone,
  city.city AS city, 
  country.country AS country, 
  s.store_id AS SID
FROM 
  staff AS s 
JOIN 
  address AS a ON s.address_id = a.address_id 
JOIN 
  city ON a.city_id = city.city_id
JOIN 
  country ON city.country_id = country.country_id
